body_html: @dtracers: Like numpy, tf.equal returns a broadcasted tensor of whatever shapes you gave it as input. You can only use it as a conditional if the shape is scalar (0-dimensional). tf.reduce_all or tf.reduce_any can be used to collapse to a scalar, or tf.squeeze_dims in this case.
body_text: @dtracers: Like numpy, tf.equal returns a broadcasted tensor of whatever shapes you gave it as input.  You can only use it as a conditional if the shape is scalar (0-dimensional).  tf.reduce_all or tf.reduce_any can be used to collapse to a scalar, or tf.squeeze_dims in this case.
body: @dtracers: Like numpy, `tf.equal` returns a broadcasted tensor of whatever shapes you gave it as input.  You can only use it as a conditional if the shape is scalar (0-dimensional).  `tf.reduce_all` or `tf.reduce_any` can be used to collapse to a scalar, or `tf.squeeze_dims` in this case.
